context.p: The settings allow users to receive notifications of warning or outbreak events by emails.

step.cmd: Go to Administration SMTP Settings for specifying the SMTP server setting required for notification sending.
Specify the Server address, Port, and Sender.
(Optional) If the SMTP server requires authentication, click the checkbox next to SMTP server requires authentication. Specify the User name and Password as the SMTP server authentication credential.
Click the Send Test Email button to send a test email from StellarOne (This step is essential for Step 12).
Click Save to complete the SMTP setting.
Go to Administration Notification for notification criteria and email setting.
Under the Warning Level Agent Events, click the Send warning level agent events toggle to enable it.

note.p: When the switch under Warning Level Agent Events is enabled, StellarOne console will send a notification to your email when an incident that triggers a “Warning” happens.

step.cmd: Under the Outbreak, click the Send outbreak notifications toggle to enable it.

note.p: When the switch under Outbreak is enabled, StellarOne console will send a notification to your email when more than a specified number of open warning messages have appeared in a specified time period.

step.cmd: Define an outbreak by the number of detections and the detection period.

li.p: Specify the number of occurrences of an event in the field of Number of warnings in a time period (1- 20000).
Specify the time frame during which the event has occurred in the field of The time period of those warnings (1 - 60 minutes).

step.cmd: Under Email Notifications, specify the email address for receiving the notifications in the Send to field.
Click Save to complete the setting.
Go to the specified email box to check if you receive the test email sent from StellarOne (refer to Step 4).
